text: Hi <@UUKNT3HB3>. I would suggest places where engineers and tech-related people hang out more frequently. eg. Twitter, Reddit, audience-specific channels on Discord and Slack. I would also consider places where HR and Recruitment (technical recruiters) are found as well.

elements.text: . I would suggest places where engineers and tech-related people hang out more frequently. eg. Twitter, Reddit, audience-specific channels on Discord and Slack. I would also consider places where HR and Recruitment (technical recruiters) are found as well.

text:
<@U01KDQGQ82H> it sounds as though what you're aiming for is a sub-strategy for product-led content. I agree with Sam, in that it can be difficult to hone this down into one cohesive thing. Often, product-related copy is going to be focused on a certain stage of awareness your prospect is currently at (say, solution aware). Your content should always be inclusive of your target ICP(s), and of course it includes your brand voice, but product-led content can have a different structure than non-product related content.

Can you expand or clarify on what your ask is?

elements.text:
it sounds as though what you're aiming for is a sub-strategy for product-led content. I agree with Sam, in that it can be difficult to hone this down into one cohesive thing. Often, product-related copy is going to be focused on a certain stage of awareness your prospect is currently at (say, solution aware). Your content should always be inclusive of your target ICP(s), and of course it includes your brand voice, but product-led content can have a different structure than non-product related content.

Can you expand or clarify on what your ask is?

text:
Sure <@U02MGP08MNH>.

How does the integration of product marketing insights, audience targeting, brand voice and content structure and awareness stage get communicated to your content writers at the content briefing stage?

Can all of this be done programmatically in a content brief?

elements.text:
.

How does the integration of product marketing insights, audience targeting, brand voice and content structure and awareness stage get communicated to your content writers at the content briefing stage?

Can all of this be done programmatically in a content brief?

text:
<@U01KDQGQ82H> thank you! So, personally, I think it happens at the strategy phase based on the type of content you're creating and the ICP(s) you're creating content for. If you're doing it on a piece-by-piece basis, then it's likely not tying back to a larger or overarching strategy. I'd say you'd be better off creating buckets/themes/pillars for the content you want to create, then develop content brief templates for each bucket/theme/pillar so use those programmatically. Sort of like a guideline or 'must-haves' for the content that falls under each bucket/theme/pillar.

Product marketing insights will most likely come into play across late middle/early bottom-of-funnel content, because it's bound to be more tactical and product-focused than your TOFU, strategic content. Plus, product-led content that takes into account product insights is more useful in the MOFU/BOFU stage, as that's likely where people are going to be solution aware, evaluating, etc. Not sure if that helps!

elements.text:

Sort of like a guideline or 'must-haves' for the content that falls under each bucket/theme/pillar.

Product marketing insights will most likely come into play across late middle/early bottom-of-funnel content, because it's bound to be more tactical and product-focused than your TOFU, strategic content. Plus, product-led content that takes into account product insights is more useful in the MOFU/BOFU stage, as that's likely where people are going to be solution aware, evaluating, etc. Not sure if that helps!

text: That helps <@U02MGP08MNH>. I was naively thinking of incorporating product insights in the TOFU too, but your rationale helps filter that from the equation for me. Thank you!

elements.text: . I was naively thinking of incorporating product insights in the TOFU too, but your rationale helps filter that from the equation for me. Thank you!

text: <@U01KDQGQ82H> you can definitely incorporate product insights into TOFU or what I call warm TOFU content (the stuff that helps branch that sudden jump from TOFU to MOFU offerings), but if people are just beginning to consume your content or learn about your brand, they'll likely be looking for helpful thought leadership content than something super product-focused. Product insights at the TOFU stage are helpful if they assist in validating a person's core reasons or incentives for beginning to research potential solutions to their problems!

elements.text: you can definitely incorporate product insights into TOFU or what I call warm TOFU content (the stuff that helps branch that sudden jump from TOFU to MOFU offerings), but if people are just beginning to consume your content or learn about your brand, they'll likely be looking for helpful thought leadership content than something super product-focused. Product insights at the TOFU stage are helpful if they assist in validating a person's core reasons or incentives for beginning to research potential solutions to their problems!

text: <@UUKNT3HB3> you could also mention how recruiters and talent acquisition pros can leverage diverse job boards and digital communities to share open roles or news about a company to attract candidates. For example, Codility is an option, but there are also niche communities online as well as job boards dedicated specifically to diverse candidates. Consider neurodiverse job boards and communities, too
